Instrument.name: HISCALE Low-Energy Magnetic Spectrometer for Ulysses
Instrument.description: The Low-Energy Magnetic Spectrometers (LEMS) are designed for high sensitivity measurements of low energy electron and ion fluxes. They use pulse-height analysis with active anticoincidence and consist of two types of telescopes: LEMS 30 and LEMS 120, differentiated by the angle of their axes relative to the spacecraft spin axis. Each telescope contains pairs of silicon surface barrier detectors that offer almost full spherical coverage during spacecraft rotation. Electrons below 300 keV are redirected from primary detectors using a rare-earth magnet, and the instruments are calibrated through computer ray tracing and particle accelerator studies. Tables included detail the configurations and energy channels for both electron and ion detection.
